page.title: 08MRS HODGE,THE FARMER.
page.content: MRS.HODGE gets up at 6.30 a.m. and starts work at 7.30.a.m.She has 4 sheep,2 ducks,8 horses,4 cats,1 dog,7 tractors and 1 combine. It is a hard job to run a farm.She lives in a big house,with 5 barns and 460 acres to look after. There are 3 workers who live in cottages at one side of the farm to help Mrs.Hodge.To get to the farm you go up a long drive with an orchard on one side. There is a big pond where the ducks live. Behind the house there is a chalk pit where they have a pigeon shoot. The chalk is not used to make lime for the fields any more but it is sometimes used to make new farm tracks. Inside the house the rooms are gi-normous. There was a very big table in the room we were in.There were bells for servants-but no servants-and in the kitchen there was a very big cooker. BY SIMON
